or exploited by the market.`` We hated the whole frenzy of the push for homeownership, and then watching low-income people being raped of equity,'' says Brenda Torpy, CEO of the Champlain Housing Trust. Poor people never get rich in the real-estate market. If prices go up, you can't afford to buy a home. But if prices go down, you lose tremendous value. Torpy has been with the Burlington shared-equity project from the beginning. Initially, Mayor Sen.
